    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      javafx.scene.Node getNodeByRowColumnIndex(int row, int column, javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane)
      getNodeByRowColumIndex - help method: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> gives back the node at a a specific column index of a GridPane -> used in initialize method to indicate valid placement ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
      void handlerSetOnDragDetected(javafx.scene.control.Label shipLabel, int shipSize, boolean alreadyPlaced)
      makeLabelDraggable - help method: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> makes a label draggable - for ShipSize 2,3,4,5 -> difference between placing new ship and moving existing ship: - new ship means the dragged label is a label at the right hand side of the playground -> this label will still be displayed - existing ship means the dragged label is label in the playground -> this label has to disappear once it is moved
      void initialize(java.net.URL location, java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
      initialize-method: ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -> initialize of default configuration: Start-Button disabled, start-Image of the Rotate-Button, save all necessary in ActiveGameState... -> creates labels that fill the GridPane: this labels recognize Drag&Drop -> Ships can be dropped into them -> backend-stuff executed -> make ShipLabels at the right side of the Playground draggable -> can be placed on Playground -> when ship is Placed: a Label is placed on top of the Grid-Pane to indicate a Placed-Ship: this Label is just like the ShipLabel at the right side, it can be dragged -> so already placed ships can be moved ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
      void moveShip(ShipLabel existingShipLabel, int finalX, int finalY)
      moveShip - help method: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> called when existing ship label is successfully moved -> Gui: moving already placed ship to a new location: change coordinates of the moved ship label -> backend representation: moveShip is called
      void newRandomPlacement()
      random placement button: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> creates a new playground - eventually placed ships are deleted -> places all ships randomly - KI does that -> enables the ready button due to all ships being placed ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
      void placeNewShip(ShipLabel newShipLabel)
      placeNewShip - help method: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> called when ship label is successfully dropped for the first time -> at first, the ship label is made draggable -> then the ship label is placed at the right place in the group -> at the end a new ship is created in the back end representation of the playground
      void resetPlacement()
      reset placement button: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> creates a new playground - eventually placed ships are deleted -> places all ships randomly - KI does that -> enables the ready button due to all ships being placed ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
      void rotateShip90()
      rotate ship button: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> changes graphic: the arrow point of the arrows change between being horizontal and vertical -> boolean horizontal is inversed - used by ship placement methods ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
      void setBackground()
      setBackground - help method: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> sets the background of the scene ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
      void setLanguage() 
      void setShipLabelPlace(ShipLabel shipLabel)
      setShipLabelPlace - help method: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> when ship is placed or moved, shipLabel of Group indicating its position has to be placed at the right spot -> this spot is computed and set here for the label
      void startGame()
      ready button: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> starts the game ( = switches scene to gamePlayground), only clickable when all ships are placed in a valid way ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • initialize

        public void initialize(java.net.URL location,
                       java.util.ResourceBundle resources)
        initialize-method: ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- -> initialize of default configuration: Start-Button disabled, start-Image of the Rotate-Button, save all necessary in ActiveGameState... -> creates labels that fill the GridPane: this labels recognize Drag&Drop -> Ships can be dropped into them -> backend-stuff executed -> make ShipLabels at the right side of the Playground draggable -> can be placed on Playground -> when ship is Placed: a Label is placed on top of the Grid-Pane to indicate a Placed-Ship: this Label is just like the ShipLabel at the right side, it can be dragged -> so already placed ships can be moved ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
        Specified by:
        initialize in interface javafx.fxml.Initializable

      • setLanguage

        public void setLanguage()

      • rotateShip90

        public void rotateShip90()
        rotate ship button: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> changes graphic: the arrow point of the arrows change between being horizontal and vertical -> boolean horizontal is inversed - used by ship placement methods ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • newRandomPlacement

        public void newRandomPlacement()
        random placement button: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> creates a new playground - eventually placed ships are deleted -> places all ships randomly - KI does that -> enables the ready button due to all ships being placed ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • resetPlacement

        public void resetPlacement()
        reset placement button: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> creates a new playground - eventually placed ships are deleted -> places all ships randomly - KI does that -> enables the ready button due to all ships being placed ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

        public void startGame()
               throws java.io.IOException
        ready button: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> starts the game ( = switches scene to gamePlayground), only clickable when all ships are placed in a valid way ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

        public javafx.scene.Node getNodeByRowColumnIndex(int row,
                                                 int column,
                                                 javafx.scene.layout.GridPane gridPane)
        getNodeByRowColumIndex - help method: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> gives back the node at a a specific column index of a GridPane -> used in initialize method to indicate valid placement ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • handlerSetOnDragDetected

        public void handlerSetOnDragDetected(javafx.scene.control.Label shipLabel,
                                     int shipSize,
                                     boolean alreadyPlaced)
        makeLabelDraggable - help method: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> makes a label draggable - for ShipSize 2,3,4,5 -> difference between placing new ship and moving existing ship: - new ship means the dragged label is a label at the right hand side of the playground -> this label will still be displayed - existing ship means the dragged label is label in the playground -> this label has to disappear once it is moved
        Parameters:
        shipLabel: - the Label (!! not a ShipLabel) that has to be made draggable
        shipSize: - the size of the ship, needed here because shipLabel is a Label
        alreadyPlaced: - boolean that indicates whether ship is a new one or an existing one that has to be moved ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • setShipLabelPlace

        public void setShipLabelPlace(ShipLabel shipLabel)
        setShipLabelPlace - help method: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> when ship is placed or moved, shipLabel of Group indicating its position has to be placed at the right spot -> this spot is computed and set here for the label
        Parameters:
        shipLabel: - ShipLabel of the to be placed ship ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • placeNewShip

        public void placeNewShip(ShipLabel newShipLabel)
        placeNewShip - help method: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> called when ship label is successfully dropped for the first time -> at first, the ship label is made draggable -> then the ship label is placed at the right place in the group -> at the end a new ship is created in the back end representation of the playground
        Parameters:
        newShipLabel: - ShipLabel of the new to be placed ship ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

      • moveShip

        public void moveShip(ShipLabel existingShipLabel,
                     int finalX,
                     int finalY)
        moveShip - help method: ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ -> called when existing ship label is successfully moved -> Gui: moving already placed ship to a new location: change coordinates of the moved ship label -> backend representation: moveShip is called
        Parameters:
        existingShipLabel: - the ShipLabel of the Ship that has to be moved
        finalX: - the X-postion where the Ship should be moved to
        finalY: - the Y-position where the Ship should be moved to ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
